docs.abstract: Apple accused NSO Group, the Israeli surveillance company, of “flagrant” violations of its software, as well as federal and state laws.
docs.snippet: Apple accused NSO Group, the Israeli surveillance company, of “flagrant” violations of its software, as well as federal and state laws.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple sued the NSO Group, the Israeli surveillance company, in federal court on Tuesday, another setback for the beleaguered firm and the unregulated spyware industry.

headline.main: Apple Sues Israeli Spyware Maker, Seeking to Block Its Access to iPhones
headline.print_headline: Apple Sues to Block Israeli Spyware Firm From iPhone Access

docs.abstract: Apple said it would soon provide parts, tools and manuals to those who wanted to fix their own iPhones and Mac computers.
docs.snippet: Apple said it would soon provide parts, tools and manuals to those who wanted to fix their own iPhones and Mac computers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple delivered an early holiday gift on Wednesday to the eco-conscious and the do-it-yourselfers: It said it would soon begin selling the parts, tools and instructions for people to do their own iPhone repairs.

headline.main: What Apple’s New Repair Program Means for You (and Your iPhone)
headline.print_headline: Apple Opens the Way for Do-It-Yourself Repairs to Its Products

docs.abstract: Apple may have to rewrite its policies to allow app developers to point users to alternative payment methods as soon as December.
docs.snippet: Apple may have to rewrite its policies to allow app developers to point users to alternative payment methods as soon as December.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled on Tuesday that Apple could not delay making changes to its App Store, a move that could soon allow app developers to directly communicate with customers about ways to pay for services outside Apple’s ecosystem.

headline.main: Judge denies Apple’s request to delay App Store changes.

docs.abstract: “I think it’s reasonable to own it as part of a diversified portfolio,” Apple’s chief executive said at the DealBook Online Summit.
docs.snippet: “I think it’s reasonable to own it as part of a diversified portfolio,” Apple’s chief executive said at the DealBook Online Summit.
docs.lead_paragraph: While Apple might not offer users a way to pay with cryptocurrency anytime soon, its leader has invested in it personally.

headline.main: Tim Cook has invested in cryptocurrency personally, but Apple has no plans to do so.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: One of the leaders of an activist movement at Apple took her complaint to a federal agency, marking an escalation of a conflict between Apple and some of its workers.
docs.snippet: One of the leaders of an activist movement at Apple took her complaint to a federal agency, marking an escalation of a conflict between Apple and some of its workers.
docs.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

headline.main: Another Apple Worker Says the Company Retaliated Against Her
headline.print_headline: Tensions Between Apple and Its Workers Escalate With a Federal Complaint

docs.abstract: Ifeoma Ozoma, who accused Pinterest of discrimination, has become a key figure in helping tech employees disclose, and fight, mistreatment at work.
docs.snippet: Ifeoma Ozoma, who accused Pinterest of discrimination, has become a key figure in helping tech employees disclose, and fight, mistreatment at work.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last month, Gov. Gavin Newsom of California signed a bill to expand protections for people who speak up about discrimination in the workplace.

headline.main: A Tech Whistle-Blower Helps Others Speak Out

docs.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif — Apple this month unveiled an array of new gadgets: more powerful MacBook laptop computers, AirPod wireless headphones with longer battery life and HomePod Mini speakers in three more colors.

headline.main: Apple’s Most Back-Ordered New Product Is Not What You Expect
headline.print_headline: A $19 Cloth: A Must-Buy And a Meme

docs.abstract: Apple’s custom processors suggest that computers are nowhere near hitting their performance limits.
docs.snippet: Apple’s custom processors suggest that computers are nowhere near hitting their performance limits.
docs.lead_paragraph: For decades, the chip-making giant Intel reigned as one of the most technically advanced companies in Silicon Valley.

headline.main: The Chip That Could Transform Computing
headline.print_headline: The Chip That Could Transform Computing

docs.abstract: The comic actors talk about playing more complex roles in this Apple TV+ series about a psychiatrist who insinuates himself into the life of a needy patient.
docs.snippet: The comic actors talk about playing more complex roles in this Apple TV+ series about a psychiatrist who insinuates himself into the life of a needy patient.
docs.lead_paragraph: As viewers, we are preconditioned to expect a zany comedy when we see Will Ferrell and Paul Rudd paired up, thanks to past collaborations like the madcap 2004 hit “Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy” and its equally classy 2013 sequel, “Anchorman 2: The Legend Continues.”

headline.main: The Doctor Is in Too Deep: Will Ferrell and Paul Rudd on ‘The Shrink Next Door’

docs.abstract: What we want to know from Secretary of State Antony Blinken, G.M.’s Mary Barra, the podcast hosts Dax Shepard and Monica Padman, and more.
docs.snippet: What we want to know from Secretary of State Antony Blinken, G.M.’s Mary Barra, the podcast hosts Dax Shepard and Monica Padman, and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: On the second day of the DealBook Online Summit, more top newsmakers in business, policy and culture will take the virtual stage. Here’s the lineup, with one big question we have for each session:

headline.main: China, Electric Vehicles and More at the DealBook Online Summit

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Jason Karaian, Sarah Kessler, Stephen Gandel, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
